verses.text: Oracle on Moab Alas! In a night has Ar-Moab been wasted and ruined. Alas! In a night has Kir-Moab been wasted and ruined.
Gone up is the daughter of Dibon to weep on the heights; on the summits of Nebo and medeba Moab wails. On every head there is baldness, and beards are all shorn.
On her streets they have girt them with sackcloth, on roofs is lament; on her squares, one and all they are wailing with torrents of tears.
Heshbon and Elealeh cry out, and their cry reaches Jahaz; whereat Moab’s loins fall a-quiver, the soul of her quivers.
My heart cruet out for Moab, they flee towards Zoar; they climb the ascent unto Luhith and weep as they go; they raise on the way to Horonaim a cry of destruction.
For ruin has clean overtaken the waters of Nimrim; the herbage is gone, the grass withered, and verdure is none.
So they bring o’er the Brook of the Willows their riches and stores;
for the cry (of despair) has gone round all the borders of Moab; the wail thereof reaches Eglaim, it reaches Beer-elim.
For the waters of Dimon are bloody. Yet more will I bring upon Dimon – a lion on those who escape and are left out of Moab.
